image.alt: Smiling patients at Bovenizer & Baker Orthodontics

paragraphs.text: Bovenizer & Baker Orthodontics is a top-rated, community-rooted orthodontic practice serving Cary, Apex and Morrisville. We combine a down-to-earth patient experience with advanced technology (iTero 3D scanning, iCAT 3D x‑rays and in‑house 3D printing) and conservative, individualized treatment planning. Our doctors focus on predictable, board-quality results while making treatment fun and accessible for the whole family.

items.title: Community Focus
items.text: We’re embedded in the Cary/Apex/Morrisville communities and give back through local sponsorships and our “A Chance to Smile” program.

items.title: Advanced Technology

image.alt: Digital scanning and advanced orthodontic technology

items.text: iTero digital scanning, iCAT 3D imaging, 3D printing for retainers, and Damon/Invisalign<sup>®</sup> expertise deliver faster, more accurate, and more comfortable care.

items.title: Patient‑first Care
items.text: We emphasize appropriate timing and individualized plans, choosing observation when appropriate and starting treatment only when a patient is ready.

paragraphs.text: Dr. Todd Bovenizer is a board‑certified orthodontist with DDS and MS degrees and extensive leadership in the specialty. He holds ABO certification (including re‑certification), has served as president of state orthodontic groups, and lectures nationally on the Damon system. Dr. Bo brings a family-first approach to care and leads clinical excellence across the practice.

Dr. Christopher Baker is a board‑certified orthodontist trained in Damon and Invisalign techniques. Raised around orthodontics, he brings both technical skill and a patient-centered approach to care. Dr. Baker and his family are active in the community and committed to thoughtful, modern treatment plans.

Dr. Tonya Spangler brings a thoughtful clinical background and strong academic credentials to the team. She completed dental and orthodontic training at Virginia Commonwealth University, has published research, and enjoys helping patients achieve confident, healthy smiles through personalized treatment.
We offer Damon braces, Invisalign<sup>®</sup>, Spark-style aligners, retainers, and early interceptive care using digital planning and 3D-guided workflows to create efficient, comfortable treatment.

testimonials.author: Karen R.
testimonials.testimonial: “Very pleased with Bovenizer & Baker Orthodontics, the staff are very friendly and professional, they made the whole getting braces experience very comfortable for my son and put me at ease.”

testimonials.author: William B.
testimonials.testimonial: “Dr. Bo is a great person and does amazing work. My daughter always looks forward to her visits and the final results when her braces were removed were spectacular.”

testimonials.author: Grace B.
testimonials.testimonial: “I have had my braces for over a month now, and they are working great! I can already see the difference in my smile and my teeth!”

testimonials.author: Briana L.
testimonials.testimonial: “Bovenizer & Baker Orthodontics is a friendly environment full of great smiles. The staff works hard to make sure everyone's teeth are great in the end.”

image.alt: Drs. Bovenizer and Baker smiling together at Bovenizer & Baker Orthodontics

About.title: Our manifesto impacts every aspect of our practice.

paragraphs.text: We give you a reason to smile by focusing on an exceptional patient experience, precise clinical care, and a team that treats you like family.
Our approach favors conservative timing when appropriate, attention to microaesthetics, and finishing techniques that produce confident, lasting results.
We use state-of-the-art tools such as Damon self-ligating brackets, iTero® 3D scanning, and iCAT® 3D imaging to plan efficient, comfortable treatment.

Dr. Todd Bovenizer is a board-certified orthodontist who brings decades of clinical leadership to the practice. He has lectured nationally on Damon System techniques and mentors other clinicians through the Damon Mentor Program. Dr. Bovenizer is known for careful biomechanics and a patient-first approach.

image.alt: Dr. Todd Bovenizer smiling in the office

paragraphs.text: Education: BS in Biology from Virginia Tech; Doctor of Dental Surgery and Master’s in Orthodontics from West Virginia (orthodontic specialty).

Credentials: Board certified by the American Board of Orthodontics (re-certified); Past President, North Carolina Association of Orthodontists; member of the American Association of Orthodontists and the Southern Association of Orthodontists.

image.alt: Dr. Todd Bovenizer in the treatment room

paragraphs.text: Specialties include the Damon System, advanced biomechanics, iCAT 3D radiographic diagnosis, and high-detail finishing (microaesthetics). Outside the office he enjoys family time, soccer at the fields, wakeboarding, skiing, tennis, and travel.

image.alt: Dr. Bovenizer meeting with a patient

paragraphs.text: Dr. Christopher Baker grew up around orthodontics and brings a practiced, patient-centered style to care. He focuses on complex orthodontic mechanics and individualized treatment planning to deliver efficient, attractive results.

image.alt: Dr. Chris Baker consulting with a patient

paragraphs.text: Education: BS & MS in Biology and DDS from Indiana University; orthodontic specialty certificate and M.S. in Dentistry from Saint Louis University.
Credentials: Board certified by the American Board of Orthodontics; specialized training in Invisalign and the Damon System; active member of regional and national orthodontic associations.
Dr. Baker’s clinical focus includes Damon braces and Invisalign care at a platinum level. He enjoys family time and travel, especially island trips with his wife and sons.

image.alt: Dr. Baker working with a patient

paragraphs.text: Dr. Tonya Spangler brings an evidence-based approach to orthodontics, pairing clinical research with compassionate patient care to create predictable, comfortable treatment experiences.

image.alt: Dr. Tonya Spangler with a patient

paragraphs.text: Education: BS from the University of Virginia; DDS and orthodontic residency with a Master’s from Virginia Commonwealth University. Dr. Spangler graduated top of her class and is a published researcher in orthodontic literature.
Credentials: Clinical specialty training in orthodontics and active involvement in research and academic endeavors.

image.alt: Dr. Spangler smiling in the clinic

paragraphs.text: Dr. Spangler specializes in comprehensive orthodontic care grounded in evidence-based practice. She enjoys trail biking, hiking, beach trips, discovering restaurants, travel, and adventures with her dog, Gilly.

paragraphs.text: We love giving back to our community. We partner with schools, booster groups, and local organizations to donate time, resources, and orthodontic care. Each year the practice donates tens of thousands of dollars to local causes and has given away more than 30 free orthodontic treatments to families in need.

Get Started.title: What to expect at your first visit

paragraphs.text: Your first visit is a complimentary consultation that includes X-rays, photos, and a thorough oral exam with Dr. Bo, Dr. Baker, or Dr. Keri. This is a relaxed, no-pressure appointment where we get to know you and the concerns you have about your smile.

After the exam we’ll outline a custom treatment plan, give an estimated timeline, verify insurance benefits, and review payment options. We’ll also walk you through an arrival checklist so your appointment goes smoothly.
We accept most major insurance plans and will file claims electronically to make using your benefits as easy as possible.

Flexible payment plans are available and our treatment coordinator will help you find an option that fits your budget. New patient consultations are complimentary — call or text us at 919.234.5593 to get started.

Before your visit you can schedule online or complete intake paperwork so we’re ready when you arrive. If it’s more convenient, start with a free virtual consult by submitting photos for our doctors to review.

image.alt: Bo & Baker photo at front desk
Schedule your consultation with Bovenizer & Baker Orthodontics

og_meta.title: Get Started | Bovenizer & Baker Orthodontics
og_meta.description: Start your journey to a healthier, more confident smile with a free consultation. Schedule online or begin a virtual consult today.

image.alt: Teen girl with braces smiling outdoors

paragraphs.text: Invisalign<sup>®</sup> uses a series of clear, removable aligners to move teeth gently and predictably. Most cases — from crowding to gaps and mild bite issues — can be treated with these near-invisible trays.

We begin with a digital iTero scan to map your teeth, then deliver custom aligners you wear about 20 to 22 hours a day. Enjoy easier brushing, no brackets or wires, and a discreet path to a straighter smile.
Spark™ aligners offer a thin, strong, and highly transparent option for patients seeking clear-aligner treatment. They can be a great alternative when you want discreet, removable trays.
Like other clear systems, success depends on wear time and follow-up. We’ll scan, plan, and monitor progress so your Spark™ or similar aligner treatment stays on track.

The Damon System uses self-ligating brackets and shape-memory wires to move teeth efficiently and comfortably. Our team is a certified Damon provider and incorporates these techniques when they fit a patient’s goals.
Damon treatment often means fewer appointments, improved hygiene with no elastic ties, and options that suit kids, teens, and adults.

image.alt: Teen smiling with Damon Clear braces

paragraphs.text: Damon Metal Braces combine durability with a low-profile design. The self-ligating brackets reduce friction and make hygiene easier compared with older elastic-tied systems.
These braces are a reliable choice for more complex movements and are often selected when predictable, efficient mechanics are needed.

image.alt: Model of teeth showing Damon Metal braces

paragraphs.text: Damon Clear Braces provide a discreet ceramic option that blends with your teeth while maintaining the Damon System’s efficient mechanics.
Clear brackets require mindful care to avoid staining, but they offer an excellent balance of discretion and proven orthodontic control.

image.alt: Close-up of a clear Damon braces bracket holding an archwire

paragraphs.text: Retention is essential to protect the investment you make in your smile. We offer bonded and removable retainers, and we’ll recommend the right option based on your treatment.
Care tips include gentle daily cleaning, avoiding hot environments, and using cases to store removable retainers. We also offer a Retainer Guarantee Program for long-term protection.

To replace or maintain retainers, call or text 919.234.5593 or schedule an appointment online at https://www.bovbakerortho.com/schedule-a-free-consult/. You can also visit our contact page at https://www.bovbakerortho.com/contact/ for questions.

image.alt: Clear removable retainer in a hand

paragraphs.text: A check by age seven lets us spot growth issues early and intervene when beneficial. Phase 1 treatment can guide jaw development and reduce the need for more invasive care later.
Tools like expanders or partial braces help create room for permanent teeth and address bite problems while the child is still growing.

image.alt: Child in dental chair smiling after orthodontic check

paragraphs.text: Palatal expanders create space in the upper jaw, often preventing extractions and improving bite relationships. They’re commonly used in growing patients to guide development.
Your orthodontist will explain the device, expected timeline, and care steps so you and your child are comfortable through the process.

image.alt: Model of teeth and orthodontic appliance

image.alt: Orthodontic team smiling together in a bright, welcoming office

paragraphs.text: Don't hesitate to reach out to Dr. Bovenizer, Dr. Baker, or any member of our caring staff with questions about treatment, scheduling, or payments.

accordion.header: When will my braces come off?

paragraphs.text: Even if your treatment appears close to finished, we only remove braces when you and the doctor are completely satisfied with the alignment; taking them off too early can leave undesirable results and sometimes a few additional months are needed to finish treatment properly.

image.alt: Happy family portrait in orthodontic office

accordion.header: When will I get rubberbands and what do they do?

paragraphs.text: Rubberbands are used to adjust your bite and jaw position; whether you need them depends on your specific jaw alignment and the treatment plan the doctor prescribes.

image.alt: Orthodontic consultation in a bright clinic

accordion.header: Is a referral from my family dentist required for a consultation?

paragraphs.text: No referral is required. While many patients are referred by their dentist, most of our new patients come from family and friends or contact us directly.

image.alt: Collaborative team moment in the office

accordion.header: How do I schedule an initial consultation?

paragraphs.text: Call or text us at 919-234-5593, email frontdesk@bovbakerortho.com, or use our contact page at https://www.bovbakerortho.com/contact/ and our scheduling coordinator will help find a convenient time.

image.alt: Patient checking in at orthodontic reception

accordion.header: Is it too late to get braces as an adult?

paragraphs.text: It’s never too late. Many adults pursue orthodontic treatment for improved health, function, and confidence; roughly 30% of our patients are over age 21 and we tailor care to each adult's needs.

accordion.header: What will I learn from the initial consultation?

paragraphs.text: During the consultation the doctor will determine whether there’s an orthodontic concern, explain what must be done to correct it, give an estimated treatment timeline, review costs and payment options, and let you know if any permanent teeth would need extraction.

image.alt: Doctor explaining treatment plan to patient

accordion.header: How long will I have to wear braces?

paragraphs.text: Treatment length depends on individual needs; minor corrections may take 4–6 months, while more involved cases can take 20–26 months, and we’ll provide a personalized timeline at your consultation.

image.alt: Orthodontic team collaborating on patient care

paragraphs.text: Braces don’t usually cause pain, but they feel foreign at first and take about a week to get used to; teeth may be sore for a few days after adjustments and over-the-counter pain relievers like acetaminophen can help.

image.alt: Patient receiving comfortable care in clinic

accordion.header: How much will braces cost and are financing options available?

paragraphs.text: Fees depend on the complexity of the correction; we’ll explain exact costs and available financing during the consultation, help you maximize insurance benefits, and file claims on your behalf. See our cost and financing information at https://www.bovbakerortho.com/cost-of-treatment/.

image.alt: Financial consultation and friendly patient support

accordion.header: How often will I have appointments?

paragraphs.text: Appointment frequency varies by case, but most patients are seen every six to ten weeks for routine adjustments and progress checks.

image.alt: Patient charting and scheduling in orthodontic clinic
